fields.description:
WAS: CVS CS Ancestry: Position determined incorrectly prior to ancestry

When importing code, it creates commits on the vendor branch and MAIN at the same time - there is a 50-50 chance FE will put the MAIN commit after the verdor branch commit, meaning the ancestry goes to a parent that is later than it.

Follows on from FECRU-682
Solutions:
# Defer determination of position until we know ancestry
#* Store CS with no position
#* Make sure the ChangeSetAncestryProcessor doesn't rely on position (possible catch-22)
# Defer CS Creation until we know ancestry
fields.summary: CVS Vendor Branches: Parent is later in graph

fields.description:
The new email watches from FishEye 2.6 are pleasing to the eye. However, the directory is truncated now, whereas before a user would be able to review the entire directory of the modified file directly in the email watch. I suggest either displaying the entire directory down to the file or allowing a user configuration option to display the entire directory.

Workaround is to subscribe to RSS feeds, which still have the full directory structure.
fields.summary: FishEye 2.6 emailed watches truncate the directory

fields.description:
The same problem happens on both Firefox 4.0.1 and Internet Explorer 9:

If you go to {{FishEye Administration >> Project Settings >> Projects}} with a Firefox 4.0.1 maximized window, it will display correct.
But if you unmaximize it, some columns will be hidden, and no horizontal scrollbars will be displayed.

If you go to {{FishEye Administration >> Project Settings >> Projects}} with an Internet Explorer 9 maximized window, it will display slightly incorrect. The last column will crop some letters of the "Application Links" link. It will display only "Application Lin".
And if you unmaximize it, some columns will be hidden, and no horizontal scrollbars will be displayed.

Please see the screenshots attached for more details.
fields.summary: Non-maximized window display error on FishEye 2.6.0

fields.description:
Steps to replicate the problem:
# Loggin to fisheye as admin (http://localhost:8060/admin)
# go to Security Settings >> Authentication
# in Permissions Summary part, click on "Edit" link next for "Repository default" (action column)

The following exception is thrown:
{code}
There is no Action mapped for namespace /admin and action name editDefRepSec-default. Check if there is such an action name with such namespace defined in the xwork.xml and also if such an action class exists. Check also the log to see if the action class is successfully loaded.
Referer: http://localhost:8060/admin/securityAdmin.do
{code}

*Solution*

The new configuration screens can be found in:
Repository Settings -> Defaults -> Permissions

and for per repository
Repository Settings -> Repositories -> [REPOSITORY LINK] -> Permissions

fields.description:
Some of our admin functions call code which performs permission checks. These permission checks don't do what we want, as we may be anonymous or logged in as a non-admin user, and so not have permission to perform actions.

For instance, you can't add application links to a project unless you are logged in. See screenshot.

We could fix this by adding 'isSuperuser' method to our Principal interface.
fields.summary: Permission checks don't take superuser session flag into account

fields.description:
If you have a large number of repositories you're running the risk that FishEye will only check a part of them for updates.
E.g. 100 repos, 1 incremental index thread, default polling interval of 1 minute.
Say checking a repo for updates takes 2 seconds.
You'll see that FE checks repo001-repo030, 1 minute polling interval is up, and FE starts checking repo001 again up to repo30, ad infinitum.
Repo031-100 are never checked.
fields.summary: Polling mechanism skips repositories when there are a lot of them

fields.description:
felog is emitting the parents for a file in the right order:
{code}
$ hg felog -pm c590d
Commit Id:      c590dc97a88e5f4c204d0bdcf52ee8573d75983d
Rev Id:         24448
Branch:         2.5
Author:         Adam Ahmed <aahmed@atlassian.com>
Date:           1304043223.0-36000
Tags:           
Log Msg:        NONE: merge
Parents:        24447:bdc9e3b84e341b7118e7582a50a6209eebc511b5 24328:346b803d9ec468532b03d88637905253cf4dd802
File:           src/content/static/2static/style/style.css
  Rev:          24448:c590dc97a88e5f4c204d0bdcf52ee8573d75983d
  Status:       Modified
  Size:         77724
  Flags:        
  Binary:       False
  Parent0:      24447:bdc9e3b84e341b7118e7582a50a6209eebc511b5 src/content/static/2static/style/style.css
  Parent1:      24316:071dc3e1e2e6c12889f7778e864aadd558c314a8 src/content/static/2static/style/style.css
diff --git a/src/content/static/2static/style/style.css b/src/content/static/2static/style/style.css
--- a/src/content/static/2static/style/style.css
+++ b/src/content/static/2static/style/style.css
@@ -1863,1 +1863,1 @@
-    font-size: 1.1em;	
+    font-size: 1.1em;    
{code}

But (see screenshot or https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE-hg/src/content/static/2static/style/style.css?focusedRev=c590dc97a88e5f4c204d0bdcf52ee8573d75983d&fromRev=071dc3e1e2e6c12889f7778e864aadd558c314a8&toRev=c590dc97a88e5f4c204d0bdcf52ee8573d75983d#rc590dc97a88e5f4c204d0bdcf52ee8573d75983d), In FE, they are being picked up in the reverse order.

Thus the LoC says +1-1 but if you click the "Diff" link you go here: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE-hg/src/content/static/2static/style/style.css?r2=c590dc97a88e5f4c204d0bdcf52ee8573d75983d&r1=071dc3e1e2e6c12889f7778e864aadd558c314a8 instead of https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE-hg/src/content/static/2static/style/style.css?r1=bdc9e3b84e341b7118e7582a50a6209eebc511b5&r2=c590dc97a88e5f4c204d0bdcf52ee8573d75983d&u=20

fields.description:
After setting the "Minimum Font Size" parameter on Firefox 3.6, makes the layout break on the Source View inside FishEye.

Steps to reproduce:

* Access a source view in any FishEye repository
* Access "Preferences on Firefox;
* Select the "Content" tab
* Click on the Advanced Button on the right side of the "Default Font + Size" preferences;
* The option "Minimum Font Size" that is set to NONE, must be set to 14;

The error reproduces on the versions 3.6 and 4.0 of Firefox.
The first Screenshot is from a Default font config on browser. The second is after setting the parameter.

Related Issues:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-20619

Cheers
Nícolas

fields.description:
.A [support case|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-2714] is getting too-long primary keys because that table is using 3 nvarchar columns as its keys.  That's terrible - this table should be normalized.

username column = should be a user id (but I do remember valid reasons for this - mostly because we didn't have time to fix our FE vs cru user management discrepancies).
item type column = should 100% be a recently_visited_item_type_id foreign keyed, if you like, to a recently_visited_item_type table, not an nvarchar(80)
entity_id = should be an actual id, not an nvarchar(255)

This problem will affect every user trying to migrate to SQL Server.  However, it's  just a warning - it isn't causing the migration to fail as I originally thought.
fields.summary: cru_recently_visited and cwd_property needs denormalization - causing invalid primary keys warnings

fields.description:
With the release of FishEye/Crucible 2.6.0 the support for JRE/JDK 5 was dropped.
JRE/JDK 1.6 is now required.
This is clearly documented on the [Supported Platforms page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Supported+Platforms].
Without comparing with the previous Supported Platforms page, you wouldn't know that this requirement has changed.
It might be useful to mention it on the [FishEye 2.6 Upgrade Guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+2.6+Upgrade+Guide], so users are made aware of the changed requirement.
fields.summary: Mention that support for JDK 1.5 and IE 7 were dropped in FisheEye and Crucible's 2.6 Upgrade Guides

fields.description:
With the release of FishEye/Crucible 2.6.0 the [support for JRE/JDK 5 was dropped|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Supported+Platforms].
JRE/JDK 1.6 is now required.
Can FishEye/Crucible check the Java version at startup and complain when it isn't 1.6?
Of course this should be a bit more flexible to cater for future version compatibility.

fields.description:
I believe, but cannot prove, that we have multiple writers/locks on the same index.

Lock timeouts are occuring in Lucene, but "timeout" is misleading.  It actually is just trying once and failing. I believe it may be due to the fact that create a new IndexWriter every time you call IndexHandle.createIndex, but have another lazy-inited IndexWriter created through getWriter.

A possible cause for this is through starting a repository in Admin, which takes you eventually to:

{code}
Caused by: org.apache.lucene.store.LockObtainFailedException: Lock obtain timed out: NativeFSLock@/data/fecru/data/var/cache/grm-margin_support/idx2/write.lock
	at org.apache.lucene.store.Lock.obtain(Lock.java:84)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.init(IndexWriter.java:1066)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.<init>(IndexWriter.java:888)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.lucene.writer.DefaultIndexWriterFactory.newIndexWriter(DefaultIndexWriterFactory.java:12)
{code}

[CRC-2584|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-2584] is a case where this is occuring.
fields.summary: Ensure only one Lucene IndexWriter is created per index.

fields.summary: Add Changeset ID 'smart search' interceptor

fields.description:
When a user types certain queries in the quicksearch box (e.g. a commit id or a review key) we should redirect them to the specified entity (a changeset or review respectively) instead of taking them to the search results page.

Implementation notes:

# This should only happen for searches in the top right hand corner text field, searches using the field on the top left of the quicksearch page should not perform a 'smart' search. This is so users have the option of searching for a CSID / Review Key in other facets if they need to.
# We should only redirect to a changeset when there is one CSID that matches the partial hash entered by the user. Otherwise, if there are multiple hits, just behave as a normal quicksearch.
# We should perform a quick compiled regex check of the query to see whether it is in a format that appears to be a CSID (e.g. [0-9a-f]{4,}) or review key (e.g. [A-Z\-]{2,}-\d+) before searching for a matching entity, so we don't significantly impact the performance of the selected search facet in the case of no review key / changeset match.
fields.summary: 'Smart' search when using search box in top right hand corner

fields.description:

fields.description:

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:

1) Create a svn repo 'test'.
2) Delete it.
3) Create a CVS repo with the same name 'test'.
4) Search for a file that exists in both the _deleted_ svn and CVS repositories.
5) The search drop down (quick nav) will get populated with results from the _deleted_ repository as well. Expected behavior should be to display results from existing repositories only.
6) Clicking on the search result from the _deleted_ repository will result in an exception:
{noformat}
The requested resource cannot be found.
Path "<Path to file under deleted repository>" does not exist.
{noformat}

Reindexing the repository does not help.

*Workaround:*
Shut down Fisheye and remove the contents of the {{<FISHEYE_INST>/cache/globalfe}} folder.
Removing the above contents and restarting will force Fisheye to rebuild the search index from scratch.
fields.summary: Files from deleted repositories being picked up in quick nav

fields.description:
In a huge Git repository with more than 1100 tags and 1100 branches, the indexing is very slow and there's not much we can do to improve it.

We tried to follow this document as much as we can:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Tuning+FishEye

* Increased memory heap to {{-Xmx2048m}}, without success;
* We're using ssh:// protocol.
* We can't exclude paths on Git repositories.
* We tried to use the flag {{\-\-Xdisable-head-detection}} so it will not determine branch heads in DVCS.
  We also tried to use the flag {{\-\-Xdisable-tags}} so it will not record tags on commits in DVCS.
  These flags would make no Git tag information available in FE. 
  These flags helped a little: from 30 mins dealy to 7 or 12 mins after using the startup params, but still not there yet.
* We tried increasing the polling interval, but it didn't help.

The development team suggested to open this improvement request, as we cannot do much here at the moment beyond what has already been tried and suggested.

This is a core git indexing issue in Fisheye which will need more investigation.
fields.summary: Git repository indexing slowly

fields.description:
Watch emails are sent once every minute or so. Every pass, FishEye searches for unsent watches and emails all of them. The ordering of these emails are reverse chronological, such that the newest watch is emailed first. This problem is compounded for hg/git users where it is more likely to push a number of commits to the server in one go.

Hence, the following commit push:
    A, B, C, D
Can result in the emails received in the following order:
    D, C, B, A

This is frustrating when iterating over emails as the changes are seen backwards.
fields.summary: Watch emails are sent in reverse chronological order

fields.description:
Since HG and Git are not scanned chronologically, the lastModified time stored in the paths documents in lucene may be incorrect. This is because currently, the lastModified timestamp is set to the modified time of the last changeset containing that file that was indexed.

The quicknav index calculates lastModified the same it seems, and is also incorrect.

One way to fix this for DVCS repos is to do a lookup of the document before it gets added, and re-adding the Max of the new or old last modified timestamp.
fields.summary: lastModified field in path docs is incorrect for HG and Git

fields.description:
The [FishEye ClearCase document|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/ClearCase] has recently been overhauled. Andrew Myers suggested a number of further non-critical improvements for the doc, which are being tracked in this issue:
*  Mention that FishEye creates snapshot views
* Define the difference between View Location and View Storage Location (.vws) and the fact that View Storage Location is only used when FishEye creates the view, and that it defaults to whatever the CC admin sets up. Explicitly mention that View Location is not the .vws directory.
* Have a section reusing an existing view/using a dynamic view
* Make a solid recommendation on FishEye creating views vs. creating your own (i.e. should we prefer FishEye created views?)
* Perhaps a step by step process of setting up a Base CC vs. UCM Project
fields.summary: FishEye ClearCase documentation improvements

fields.description:
The annotation view for a file uses the blame as the starting point for rendering. The logic is as follows:

for each blame chunk:
* write the annotation
* for line=chunk.start to chunk.end
** write the line of the source

If for some reason the blame is incorrect (e.g. CRUC-5215) and has too few or too many lines, the resulting annotation is incorrect (truncated or extraneous blame annotations).

One example of the annotation view getting it wrong. Compare the annotated view with the raw view:

http://clearcase.sydney.atlassian.com:6060/foo/browse/base-sanity/vob/sanity/interbranch_merging/test.txt?r=\main\branch_rel2\1

Annotation view:
!https://img.skitch.com/20101216-ewtd7deag2p7ci2wai6nnbk35c.jpg!

Raw view:
!https://img.skitch.com/20101216-b1i12w6k4mgu8pgwgw9geeejic.jpg!
fields.summary: Annotation view breaks if calculated blame is incorrect

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* On the clearcase test vm, change the permissions for the 'base-sanity' ClearCase repository. 
* Save the repository. A popup is displayed informing you that the repository requires a re-index.

It seems to be specific to ClearCase repositories; the same action with a CVS repository didn't trigger a popup.
fields.summary: GWT admin: re-index is triggered when changing Permissions for a (base) ClearCase repository.

fields.description: With Clearcase / UCM. When I try to add content to a review, via "Browse Changesets", I see a list of UCM activities to choose from. But when I click on the checkbox for a changeset that contains an "." in the id, no check appears. The content is added to my review, but no visual confirmation that I checked the right changeset, no way to uncheck it either. If I click again, I get an "already included" error.
fields.summary: Check Boxes not working for Clearcase / UCM when changeset has an "." in the id

fields.description:
FishEye integrates with JIRA through its SOAP [API|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+RPC+Services] (because we need to integrate with JIRA versions that are older than 4.2, which was the first version to provide REST support), and we use Apache Axis to generate those requests.

Yet, by default, Axis with the [HTTP Client transport|http://ws.apache.org/axis/java/apiDocs/org/apache/axis/transport/http/CommonsHTTPSender.html] will generate HTTP requests with [HTTP chunking|http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec3.html#sec3.6.1] (source: debugging). All of this is nice and well except when there is a HTTP proxy in the middle, and in particular Apache with {{mod_proxy}}, which has a number of issues with HTTP chunking:

* [https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=37514] 
* [https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=37920]
* [https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=49921]
* ...

This is to implement a patch to disable HTTP chunking for our SOAP requests, which, after talking with Tim, is not necessary (our requests are not long enough to require chunking).

Context: [FSH-4550|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-4550]
fields.summary: Disable HTTP chunking when sending SOAP requests to JIRA

fields.description: We currently allow the rest client to specify the encoding format of the response by setting the "Accept: application/xml" ("../json") request header, but we may also want to offer an url parameter to do this in cases where manipulating the HTTP request headers is difficult. Many other public rest api's also offer this.
fields.summary: Support a url parameter to specify the REST return format
